Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend two movies: "Divergent" and "Man on Fire".

"Divergent" is a science fiction film that tells the story of Tris Everstone, who discovers that she is Divergent - meaning that she doesn't fit in with any of the factions based on virtues. Tris learns about the dangers of being Divergent - and as she tries to figure out what she wants to be, she finds herself drawn into a dangerous web of secrets, alliances, and betrayal. With its thrilling action sequences, powerful performances from its cast of talented actors, and compelling plot that keeps you guessing and on the edge of your seat until the very end, "Divergent" is a must-see for anyone who loves thrill-packed adventure movies filled with plenty of heart-pounding action sequences packed full of plenty of exciting twists and turns, powerful performances from its cast of talented actors, and compelling plot that keeps you guessing and on the edge of your seat until the very end.

The plot revolves around a former US Marine named Jack McCall who has turned his life into a career as a private detective. 2. "Windtalkers" (2002) - This historical drama is set during World War II and revolves around two U.S. Marines who are assigned to protect Navajo Marines, who use their native language as an unbreakable radio cypher.

The movie features an outstanding performance by Brian Van Holt, who plays the role of Chris Taylor, one of the two U.S. Marines assigned to protect Navajo Marines.
Overall, "American Gangster" and "Windtalkers" are highly recommended movies for those who enjoy historical dramas or biographical films about real-life people.
